page.title: 01REVIEW OF SOUTHSEA BLOCK
page.content: Three quarters of this block is covered by the sea with the remaining area being low-lying land and a shingle beach. This land forms the southern part of the city of {Portsmouth}. Land use is predom- inantly residential, mostly built between 1870 and 1910 in associaton with the development of Southsea seaside resort. There is a major shopping area with two department stores,local shopping streets and specialist shops such as antique shops. Much of the land adjoining the sea has uses associated with tourism,such as hotels and places of entertainent and recreation. There are also open spaces and some defence land. The block contains several conservation areas. There are three museums, a theatre,a pier and a castle.
